alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Lackawanna; Luzerne; Pike; Southern Wayne; Susquehanna; Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 13 at 3:19PM EDT until March 14 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches in elevations below 1200 feet and 8 to 14 inches above 1200 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph Tuesday. * WHERE...Bradford, Susquehanna, Wyoming, Lackawanna, Luzerne, Pike and Southern Wayne counties. * WHEN...Until 6 PM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates tonight could approach 1 to 2 inches per hour. Persistent light snow is expected through the day Tuesday. The valley floor of the Wyoming Valley will see totals on the lower end of the forecast with greatest accumulations above 1200 feet.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission strongly encourage motorist to heed all travel restrictions and delay unnecessary travel. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadways, and traffic conditions.
